case_vignette: A 28-year-old man who works as a resident in general surgery presents feeling "burned out" for the last 2 months. He says he has been working extremely long hours under stressful conditions, which makes him irritable, edgy, unfocused, and forgetful. He says he also has severe anxiety about how these symptoms are affecting his performance at work, making it difficult for him to sleep even when he has time off. The patient is referred for counseling and is prescribed some mild sleep aids. At follow-up a few months later, he says he is feeling much improved due to improved staffing at the hospital and a more manageable workload.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling really burned out, irritable, on edge, unfocused, and forgetful.
Have you recently experienced any significant stressors or changes in your life?
Yes, I have been working extremely long hours under stressful conditions.

Have you been experiencing these symptoms consistently for more than two weeks?

**Final Diagnosis:** Chronic Fatigue Syndrome.
